trans-unit.source: Launch a game
trans-unit.target: Launch a game

trans-unit.source: Beginner
trans-unit.target: Beginner

trans-unit.source: This page explains how to launch your game using Game Studio or Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: This page explains how to launch your game using Game Studio or Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: Launch a game from Game Studio
trans-unit.target: Launch a game from Game Studio

trans-unit.source: !Note Game Studio can't launch games for the Windows Store or UWP (Universal Windows Platform) platforms. To launch a game for those platforms, use Visual Studio (see below).
trans-unit.target: !Note Game Studio can't launch games for the Windows Store or UWP (Universal Windows Platform) platforms. To launch a game for those platforms, use Visual Studio (see below).

trans-unit.source: In the toolbar, select your target platform.
trans-unit.target: In the toolbar, select your target platform.

trans-unit.source: Platform selection
trans-unit.target: Platform selection

trans-unit.source: !Note You can only select platforms you selected in the Create a new game dialog when you created the project. To add additional platforms to the project, see Add or remove a platform.
trans-unit.target: !Note You can only select platforms you selected in the Create a new game dialog when you created the project. To add additional platforms to the project, see Add or remove a platform.

trans-unit.source: To run the game, click Play icon in the toolbar or press F5.
trans-unit.target: To run the game, click Play icon in the toolbar or press F5.

trans-unit.source: Game Studio play button
trans-unit.target: Game Studio play button

trans-unit.source: The Output window shows the build progress.
trans-unit.target: The Output window shows the build progress.

trans-unit.source: Output window
trans-unit.target: Output window

trans-unit.source: When the build is complete, your game starts on the selected platform.
trans-unit.target: When the build is complete, your game starts on the selected platform.

trans-unit.source: Launch a game from Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: Launch a game from Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: In Game Studio, in the toolbar, click Open in IDE (Open in IDE) to launch Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: In Game Studio, in the toolbar, click Open in IDE (Open in IDE) to launch Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: In the Visual Studio toolbar, set the appropriate project as the startup project.
trans-unit.target: In the Visual Studio toolbar, set the appropriate project as the startup project.

trans-unit.source: Select build profile in Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: Select build profile in Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: The startup project configuration is updated automatically.
trans-unit.target: The startup project configuration is updated automatically.

trans-unit.source: !TIP You can see your projects in the Solution Explorer on the right. The project filename extensions identify the platform (eg .Android, .iOS, etc).
trans-unit.target: !TIP You can see your projects in the Solution Explorer on the right. The project filename extensions identify the platform (eg .Android, .iOS, etc).

trans-unit.source: Check that the configuration and platform properly matches what you are expected.
trans-unit.target: Check that the configuration and platform properly matches what you are expected.

trans-unit.source: To start the game without debugging, press Ctrl + F5.
trans-unit.target: To start the game without debugging, press Ctrl + F5.

trans-unit.source: To start the game with debugging, click Start or press F5.
trans-unit.target: To start the game with debugging, click Start or press F5.

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio Start button
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio Start button

trans-unit.source: Remove borders
trans-unit.target: Remove borders

trans-unit.source: By default, the game runs with window borders.
trans-unit.target: By default, the game runs with window borders.

trans-unit.source: With borders
trans-unit.target: With borders

trans-unit.source: Without borders
trans-unit.target: Without borders

trans-unit.source: With borders
trans-unit.target: With borders

trans-unit.source: Without borders
trans-unit.target: Without borders

trans-unit.source: To run the game without borders, use:
trans-unit.target: To run the game without borders, use:

trans-unit.source: Game.Window.IsBorderLess = true;
trans-unit.target: Game.Window.IsBorderLess = true;

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:
